sources: Martin Fowler - Patterns of Enterprise Application Architecture
metadata.author: Ben Green

cards.question: What is the Microservices architecture pattern?
cards.answer: An approach where applications are built as a collection of small, independent services that communicate over well-defined APIs

cards.question: What is the main benefit of the Monolithic architecture?
cards.answer: Simplicity in development, testing, and deployment - everything is in one codebase and deployable unit

cards.question: What is the Event-Driven architecture pattern?
cards.answer: A pattern where components communicate through events, promoting loose coupling and asynchronous processing

cards.question: What is the Layered (N-tier) architecture?
cards.answer: Organizes code into horizontal layers (presentation, business, data) where each layer only communicates with adjacent layers

cards.question: What is the CQRS pattern?
cards.answer: Command Query Responsibility Segregation - separates read and write operations using different models for updating and displaying data

cards.question: What is the Hexagonal (Ports and Adapters) architecture?
cards.answer: Isolates core business logic from external concerns by defining ports (interfaces) and adapters (implementations)

cards.question: What is the Serverless architecture pattern?
cards.answer: Applications built using cloud functions that automatically scale and are billed only when executed

cards.question: What is the Service-Oriented Architecture (SOA)?
cards.answer: Architecture where functionality is grouped into services that communicate through well-defined interfaces and protocols
